page.title: 17CHURCH OF THE HOLY SPIRIT
page.content: The Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Spirit is built on an imposing site in Bath Road overlooking the valley.Built in the Byzantine Style its dome makes it an impressive landmark. A well established claim to fame is through the close connection of an earlier young Parish Priest, Father John O'Connor and his close friend G.K. Chesterton. Chesterton was not a Catholic and said that he had no more intention of becoming a Catholic than of becoming a cannibal. Having studied Catholicism seriously he was converted and became one of the most eloquent voices among the Catholic laity of England. Chesterton was of course writer of short stories, novelist,poet essayist, and critic and having met Father O'Connor based the character of Father Brown on his dear friend. {J.S. COOPER DEPUTY HEAD.
